title: Run, Bike, and Explore Off-Road at the Miami Trail Festival
more_content:
Tackle the trails for a day of running, biking, and competitive races at the 2nd annual Miami Trail Festival. Miami is giving you a full day of racing on some of the most unique terrain in South Florida. Connect with fellow trail lovers along Virginia Key’s beautiful mile-long beach, scenic wetlands, boardwalk, historical landmarks, hiking and bike trails, and picnic areas. The festival will be held at the Historic Virginia Key Beach Park on September 21.

[The Sports Lover’s Guide for Visiting Miami]

Run on sand, wood bridges, and limestone as you traverse Virginia Key in a 3-mile, 5-mile, or 10-mile (two laps) trail foot race. Awards will be given to the top three male and female per category and top three in each age group (14 and under, 15-19, 20-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50-59, 60+). After the marathon, feel the thrill of the Miami trails on a full suspension mountain or hardtail bike. Take a ride to the tallest point in Miami while traversing climbs, switchbacks, and fast downhills. Compete in the Expert (20 miles), Sport (15 miles), Novice (10 miles), or Junior race (ages 12-17, 5 miles) for a chance to place in the top three male and female per category and top three in each age group (18-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50+). Multiple race participants are encouraged.

[10 Miami Adventures for the Thrill-Seeking Traveler]

All participants in the trail races will receive a custom event shirt, timing chip with race number, access to hydration stations, finisher medal, post-race food and recovery beverages, age group awards, and sponsor giveaways.

Bring only the essentials (and $6 for parking). Water and post-race food and recovery beverages will be provided. Wear lightweight clothing and bring sunscreen, a hat, trail running shoes, your bike, and a helmet (mandatory for bikers). Historic Virginia Key Beach Park has on-site facilities with bikes and helmets available for rent.

Meet at the Virginia Key North Point Trails on Arthur Lamb Jr Road. For more information and to sign up for the races, visit MiamiTrailFestival.com. Do you have what it takes to become the Ultimate Trail Champion? Happy Trails!
